snippet: The Israeli defense minister, Ehud Barak, said on Monday that a terrorist attack that killed 15 Egyptian soldiers underscored a growing danger at the border between the two nations.

byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren reported from Jerusalem, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. Myra Noveck contributed reporting from Jerusalem, Fares Akram from Gaza City, and Mayy El Sheikh from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: The Israeli defense minister, Ehud Barak, said on Monday that a terrorist attack that killed 15 Egyptian soldiers underscored a growing danger at the border between the two nations.

headline.seo: Sinai Attack a ‘Wake-Up Call’ to Egypt, Israel SaysIsrael Says Sinai Attack Is a ‘Wake-Up Call’ to Egypt
headline.main: Israeli Defense Chief Says Egypt Attack a ‘Wake-Up Call’

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
